item.title: OpenAI Rolls Out Teen Safety Features Amid Growing Scrutiny
item.description: CEO Sam Altman announced an age-prediction system and new parental controls in a blog post on Tuesday.

item.title: Inside the Man vs. Machine Hackathon
item.description: At a weekend hackathon in San Francisco, more than 100 coders gathered to test whether they could beat AI—and win a $12,500 cash prize.

item.title: Should AI Get Legal Rights?
item.description: Model welfare is an emerging field of research that seeks to determine whether AI is conscious and, if so, how humanity should respond.

item.title: OpenAI Is Poised To Become The Most Valuable Startup Ever. Should It Be?
item.description: The AI startup is chasing a $500 billion valuation, with backers betting it can become the next Apple or Google. There are reasons for skepticism.

item.description: The AI startup is chasing a $500 billion valuation, with backers betting it can become the next Apple or Google. There are reasons for skepticism.

item.title: Character.AI Gave Up on AGI. Now It’s Selling Stories
item.description: Startup Character.AI once promised superintelligence. Its new CEO says it’s now an entertainment company with 20 million users.

item.title: Claude Fans Threw a Funeral for Anthropic’s Retired AI Model
item.description: Roughly 200 people gathered in San Francisco on Saturday to mourn the loss of Claude 3 Sonnet, an older AI model that Anthropic recently killed.

item.title: Meta’s AI Recruiting Campaign Finds a New Target
item.description: Meta approached more than a dozen staffers at Mira Murati’s AI startup to discuss joining its new superintelligence lab. One received an offer for more than $1 billion.
